long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
If you use Reddit at all, you've likely run into the small annoyance that is keeping tabs on interesting posts that often appear in r/AskReddit and elsewhere. It can just be too time consuming to go back and figure out what happened to some intriguing story that you read about a few hours ago. Reddit Follow-Ups uses the power of the hivemind to allow users to collaboratively decide what is the appropriate follow up to any of these kinds of posts. You can mark a post as something you want to follow and then check in your follow-ups dashboard for any possible follow-ups. Try it for yourself!

Please also understand that this is still sort of in production -- there probably are some bugs. This is sort of a crude first release, but I just wanted to see what people thought of the idea. I am more than happy to hear your suggestions and will probably implement any changes users think may be beneficial provided I have the time.

Thanks!
